intro: Spermacoce havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban star apple, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round fruits that turn red when mature. Its botanical features make it a notable species in tropical flora, often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some regions.
